publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

seg.seg: Meanwhile however [he ...] to the minister Kalendrasura ... now the name amongst those who are zealous [is] Dhaṃne
by name was my disciple Artadhana. By name however [there were] seven disciples.
... the dharma, in this retinue, the shallow and the deep manner [and] afterwards the beings ...
Thus [he] spoke like a Buddha. "We, O God! are witnesses to this thing.
The vassal kings of the father-king. When they burnt the brahmin woman ... and pulled [her] out of the fire.
... away. These four kings now preserve the world. [i.e. become cakravartins.]
Brahma is now the best of all gods. When my brother put out [my] eyes with violence...
Thereupon he spoke a word to me. He who is now Indra, lord of gods ...
Devadatta was my brother at that time, [and] caused him to forget ...
[were] ... the rākṣasas. Thereupon for the first time they gave me the cintamaṇi-jewel.
in these regions. 16. In these same eight regions however these rākṣasas came to me.
He paints these great figures of men upon this earth.

p.note: For a parallel in THT3602 see Schmidt and Malzahn.

According to 106 "[w]ritten in a medium sized ductus, of a cursive type, rather similar to that in [, , ]. The MS. is fairly clear, except for a line nearly two akṣaras wide down the centre from top to bottom, where the MS. has faded or been abraded."
"ly": written with normal "y" sign instead of ligature "Xy" sign

list.item:
[[IDP]]: Or.8212/163.
Edition: [[Broomhead I]]: 106-107, [[Schmidt KT 1983a]]: , [[Malzahn 2007a]]: , [[Schmidt KT 1983a]]: , [[Malzahn 2007a]]:.
Translation: [[Broomhead I]]: 107 (full); a1 [[Hackstein 1995]]: 78, a5 [[Thomas 1957]]: 236, a6 [[Thomas 1979b]]: 51, b1 [[Thomas 1979b]]: 58, b1f [[Thomas 1957]]: 235, b3 [[Thomas 1957]]: 228, b5 [[Hackstein 1995]]: 90, 163.

a1 /// – [k]·= [p]·ṅte no kalendraśur= amācäś ro – se ñke ñe_m\ speltkessont _t_aṃne /// a2 /// ñe_m\ tākā ñī se a_k_alṣle 9 art[ā] – ne ñe_m\ ṣu_k_t_ante no a- /// a3 /// ntā pelaikne se wertsyaine t_p_arṣke _k_at_k_are yäkne pos_t_aṃ onolme /// a4 /// te _m_aṃn_t\ wñāre pūdñäkte_śc\ reme – [s] ñ·ktā nese_m\ ce ñke wäntre[·t·] /// a5 /// lāñcä\ pātri lānte _k_alymiññi ente sudä – _ś·_a no tse_k_a_r\ brahmaṇiṃ • pwārmeṃ _s_alk· – /// a6 /// – ke 10-2 k_uce cai śtorwe[ś] no _k_ar_k_anamo ñ[·]e – – ke śtwe[r] lāñc\ cai ñäke śaiṣṣe paṣṣi – /// b1 /// [b]rahma-ñäkte po ñäkteṃntsa śvālmeṃ ñke 10-3 ente procer ñi tsāka eśne wär_k_ṣ_a – /// b2 /// – meṃ o_t\ reki weñä ñä_ś_a_śc_a se se ylai-ñäkte ñäkteṃnts\ _s_aswe ñäke ste /// b3 /// -vadatte procer ṣai ñi ce_u\ preke k_use su myārsā-ne ette lyowwa /// b4 /// śtorwonā rākṣātsānāṣeṃ o_t_a _p_arweṣṣe wsär-ñi cintamani wme- /// b5 /// ·[ā]wa toṃ _k_alymine 10-6 _m_aktoṃ okt no toṃ rakṣātsanā kmeñ-ñä[_ś]c_a /// b6 /// – wrotsānā piṅ_k_aṃ ersna toṃ onolmeṃntsä tā keṃntsa 10-7 _ś_a – ///

For a parallel in THT3602 see Schmidt and Malzahn.

a1. "ñe_m\": "_m" like "_n"

a2. "ñe_m\": "_m" like "_n"

a2. 9: ornamentary in hanging stroke

a4. "nese_m\": "_m" like "_n"

a5. "•": unusually high

b3. "ly": written with normal "y" sign instead of ligature "Xy" sign

b5. "_m_a": "_m" like "_n"

a1 Meanwhile however [he ...] to the minister Kalendrasura ... now the name amongst those who are zealous [is] Dhaṃne
a2 by name was my disciple Artadhana. By name however [there were] seven disciples.
a3 ... the dharma, in this retinue, the shallow and the deep manner [and] afterwards the beings ...
a4 Thus [he] spoke like a Buddha. "We, O God! are witnesses to this thing.
a5 The vassal kings of the father-king. When they burnt the brahmin woman ... and pulled [her] out of the fire.
a6 ... away. These four kings now preserve the world. [i.e. become cakravartins.]
b1 Brahma is now the best of all gods. When my brother put out [my] eyes with violence...
b2 Thereupon he spoke a word to me. He who is now Indra, lord of gods ...
b3 Devadatta was my brother at that time, [and] caused him to forget ...
b4 [were] ... the rākṣasas. Thereupon for the first time they gave me the cintamaṇi-jewel.
b5 in these regions. 16. In these same eight regions however these rākṣasas came to me.
b6 He paints these great figures of men upon this earth.

Alternative classifications:
Peyrot–
Malzahnmiddle ~ common archaic
Tamai–
Tamai-C14–

"<note>"_m" like "_n"" removed from transliteration a2. –Martin (Tue, 2014-09-09, 05:54:22)

[[Broomhead I]]: 107 has notes.


IDP has "Endere Fort (E.i.6)" as "site". –Martin (Fri, 2016-07-15, 01:37:39 (CEST))

Since the meter appears to be 3x 5/4-3, I marked the text accordingly. Problems remain in lines a1 and a6 due to gaps. Also, there might not be enough space for pada 15c. –Martin (Tue, 2020-02-25, 23:02:00 (CET))

According to [[Broomhead I]]: 106 "[w]ritten in a medium sized ductus, of a cursive type, rather similar to that in [[[IOL Toch 285]], [[IOL Toch 301]], [[IOL Toch 302]]]. The MS. is fairly clear, except for a line nearly two akṣaras wide down the centre from top to bottom, where the MS. has faded or been abraded."

a1 # /// tāka|(tā)k= (e)p(i)ṅte no ; +NP+ kalendraśur= , amācäś ++ ; ro – se ñake|ñke ñem ; speltkessont tane|täṃne /// a2 #9b %4 /// ñem ; tāka|tākā ñi|ñī se , akalṣälle|akälṣle 9 #9c artā(dha)ne ñem ; ṣuktante|ṣuktänte no , akalṣälle|a(kälṣle) #10a /// a3 %4 /// °ntā ; pelaikne se , wertsyaine #10b tparṣke|tpärṣke kätkare|kätkäre ; yakne|yäkne postäṃ , onolme /// #10c a4 %5 /// ; te mant|mäṃnt weñāre|wñāre , pūdñäkteśc #11a reme (we)s ñakta|ñ(ä)ktā ; nesem ce ñake|ñke , wäntarentse|wäntre(n)t(se) #11b /// a5 %4 /// lāñc ; pātri lānte , kälymiññi #11c ente sudä – ; ś·ä no tsekär , brahmaṇiṃ • #12a pwārmeṃ sälk(āmai) ; /// %4 , %3 #12b a6 /// – |ke 12 #12c k_uce cai śtorweś no ; kärkanamo|kärkänamo , ñake|ñ(k)e – – |ke #13a śtwer lāñc cai ñake|ñäke ; śaiṣṣe paṣṣīyentär|paṣṣi(yentär) /// b1 #13b +S+ %1 /// +NP+ bram-ñäkte|brahma-ñäkte ++ ; +AP+ +NP+ po ñäkteṃtsa|ñäkteṃntsa ++ , śpālmeṃ|śvālmeṃ ++ +AdvP+ ñake|ñke ++ ++ 13 #13c ente procer ñi ; tsāka eśane|eśne , warkṣältsa|wärkṣä(ltsa) #14a /// b2 +S+ %2 /// +NP+ (tu)meṃ ++ +AdvP+ ot ++ ; +V'+ reki weña|weñä ++ , +NP+ ñäśäścä ++ ++ #14b se se ylai-ñäkte ; ñäkteṃts|ñäkteṃnts saswe|säswe , ñake|ñäke ste #14c /// b3 %1 /// (de)vadatte ; procer ṣai ñi , cau|ce_u preke #15a k_use su myārsā-ne ; ette lyowwa , /// %3 #15b b4 #15c +S+ %2 /// śtorwonā ; rākṣatsanaṣṣeṃ|rākṣātsānā,ṣeṃ +AdvP+ ot|otä ++ ++ #16a pärweṣṣe wsär-ñi ; cintāmani|cintamani , wamer|wme(r) /// %2 #16b b5 %5 ; %1 /// ·āwa toṃ , kalymine|kälymine 16 #16c +S+ +NP+ mäktoṃ okt ++ no +NP+ toṃ ; rākṣatsana|rakṣātsanā ++ , +V'+ kmeṃ-ñäśc|kmeñ-ñäścä ++ ++ #17a /// b6 %5 ; %4 /// – , orotstsana|wrotsānā #17b +S+ +V'+ piṅkäṃ +NP+ ersna toṃ ; onolmeṃts|onolmeṃntsä ++ ++ , +NP+ tā kentsa|keṃntsa ++ ++ 17 #17c śä – ///

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

"<note>"_m" like "_n"" removed from transliteration . –Martin (Tue, 2014-09-09, 05:54:22)

<citedRange>107</citedRange></bibl> has notes.</p><p>IDP has "Endere Fort (E.i.6)" as "site". –Martin (Fri, 2016-07-15, 01:37:39 (CEST))</p><p>Since the meter appears to be 3x 5/4-3, I marked the text accordingly. Problems remain in lines <ref type="ms" target="__a1"/> and <ref type="ms" target="__a6"/> due to gaps. Also, there might not be enough space for pada 15c. –Martin (Tue, 2020-02-25, 23:02:00 (CET))</p></project_comment>
